16FC940A0FC743149E89F6B538D3CCA5.description: propose different courses of action to address a specific civic issue in order to create positive change in their communities, and assess the merits and effectiveness of each

3DB650F7879845368A1C4D0F1DEB7167.description: analyse a civic issue of personal interest, including how it is viewed by different groups

985D11AD15534CFF8BEAD8C6B0542A3D.description: Engaged Citizenship and Creating Change through Action: analyse a civic issue of personal interest, and propose and assess methods of creating positive change in their community

45F8FF2A81FC476B8450562976CF3464.description: identify various service opportunities available for youth within their local and/or broader communities that allow them to develop a sense of service, leadership, and commitment to their communities and to Canada

88307F13AEA24EA7BDB642071F3A7C41.description: explain various ways in which people can access information about civic matters, highlighting the importance of applying related digital literacy and critical-thinking skills, and assess the effectiveness of ways in which individuals can voice their opinions and influence others' opinions on these matters, including through social media

D2ACBB2A800744E6BA6AF97640CBC0D7.description: describe the importance of taking pride in one's country, and analyse the significance of commemorating and recognizing important events, issues, people, and/or symbols in Canada, as well as the methods by which they are recognized

543739D8782D47D79C33D278F28B4767.description: analyse ways in which various beliefs, values, and perspectives are represented in their communities, and assess whether they are equitably represented and/or valued

6C76FB1631D24C85B62CAB4F245A1786.description: explain how various actions can contribute to the common good at the local, national, and/or global level

042C0027F6B44FCDB7492B39C287EE6E.description: Civic Contributions, Inclusion, and Service: analyse the importance of various contributions to the common good, and assess the recognition of beliefs, values, and perspectives, in communities in Canada and internationally

2CE2518E29F941279F60E80C0DBBD2FE.description: identify examples of human rights violations around the world, and assess the effectiveness of responses to such violations

0C8AB1A59F434A00A15CF5E6B284B5E0.description: analyse rights and responsibilities of citizenship within a global context, including those related to international conventions, laws, and/or institutions

B7E5490C55B84980B3081145F007431E.description: explain how the judicial system and other institutions and/or organizations affect the rights of individuals and the public good in Canada

E88D0280620F4427BE9CE671EDDF00BA.description: explain how people living in Canada can exercise their rights and freedoms in order to effect positive social change

EF25641CB29C42208AF830C3EE7D2582.description: analyse key responsibilities associated with Canadian citizenship

D12DCF7CB6BB41D994677E0D47DA98C5.description: analyse key constitutional documents and rights and freedoms of Canadians established and protected by these documents, including the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms, and how foundational historical documents, including the Magna Carta, the British North America Act, 1867 (now titled Constitution Act, 1867), and the Canadian Bill of Rights, informed and helped shape Canada's Constitution

586AC189E14C4CEE8CFE7C0D185A5EC9.description: Rights and Responsibilities: analyse key rights and responsibilities associated with citizenship, in both the Canadian and global context, and some ways in which these rights are protected or may be infringed upon

9FA8BAB0C3BA4090A24D81EAF2DA32B3.description: describe Canada's form of government, and demonstrate an understanding of the electoral process and the formation of governments in Canada

0E654C8B68C144FDA790B836D94E23C1.description: explain, with reference to issues of civic importance, including economic issues, how various domestic, foreign, and international groups and institutions can influence government policy, and describe ways in which government policy affects individuals' lives and the economy

ACA38A871A944823BDBA743B4E8AE7BA.description: describe the process for amending an existing law or passing a new law federally and provincially

1C389E289B304E649E84943C382F0881.description: describe some of the ways in which different levels of government in Canada raise revenue, and explain how budgets can be designed by governments to address both short-term needs and long-term plans

3825F8DE0F5348B98B8E7079791027DB.description: describe, with reference to federal, provincial, and territorial governments, the functions of the three branches of government in Canada (i.e., executive, legislative, judicial) and the roles/responsibilities of key positions within governments, and explain how the branches can affect political, economic, and social stability in Canada

9F7796650A2145DEB13E12A206AEF4D1.description: describe Indigenous governing systems and structures, both those created by the Indian Act and those that predate or exist alongside the Act, and how they interact with the federal, provincial, territorial, and municipal governments of Canada, and explain how treaties, Crown-Indigenous relations, and/or Indigenous claims to sovereignty affect a region of their choice in Ontario or Canada

6E18F495A3814221916C16837F82348B.description: explain, with reference to issues of civic importance, the roles and responsibilities of the two orders of government in Canada (federal and provincial), as well as of territorial, municipal, and Indigenous governments, and of key positions within each

4496615D7A5A46018158758D30A97F06.description: identify the political parties in Canada and their position on the political compass, and explain objectively how the beliefs/values that underpin these parties may affect their perspectives on and/or approaches to issues of civic importance

C842F96A2B274B7D875CC32E70107185.description: Canadian and Indigenous Governance Systems: explain, with reference to a range of issues of civic importance, the roles and responsibilities of various institutions, structures, and positions in Canadian and Indigenous governance systems, treaty relationships, and other Crown-Indigenous relations

8BC07529A42B4B7A87D462A97902E621.description: communicate their own position on some issues of civic importance at the local, national, and/or global level, explaining how their position is influenced by their beliefs/values

D236AEB084A04CD686E0797032F88618.description: explain why it is important for people to engage in civic action, and identify various reasons why individuals and groups have engaged, and continue to engage, in such action, using both historical and current examples

C68F8C8975524C7EA3742B264B703881.description: analyse the methods and influence of foreign actors on democratic values in Canada, elections, and political discourse, including through the use of social media

0C0A6309BA2B4B88A18B0DC0AD305EB9.description: describe fundamental beliefs and values associated with democratic citizenship in Canada, including democracy, human rights, freedom, and the rule of law, identifying some of their key historical foundations, and explain ways in which these beliefs and values are reflected in citizen actions

34E778E930404117A295C26FE90CDF88.description: Civic Issues, Democratic Values: describe beliefs and values associated with democratic citizenship in Canada, and explain how they are related to civic action and to one's position on civic issues

A22CF324376547D39AC430D68684AE35.description: identify some careers in which civics and citizenship education might be useful

E0711B7887D34BCAA66FFEC367F0B7F0.description: apply the concepts of political thinking when analysing current events and issues involving local, national, and global communities

2413CDD1C95C4EB2B75FC975C9CD72FF.description: apply communication skills, showing consideration for diverse perspectives and experiences, when engaging in discussion of complex civic issues and sensitive topics, including those related to political processes

B28277A94ADA4401A629088F45EC8A69.description: describe some ways in which political inquiry can help them develop skills, including transferable skills and skills related to the citizenship education framework, that can be applied to the world of work and/or to everyday life

F7CC340E901F43CDAC643CAFE90A4252.description: Developing Transferable Skills: apply in everyday contexts skills developed through investigations related to civics and citizenship education, and identify some careers in which civics and citizenship education might be an asset

DF61F360A13440C7880F8F9498EF37C9.description: communicate their ideas, arguments, and conclusions using terminology, formats, and styles appropriate for specific audiences and purposes, and use accepted forms of documentation to acknowledge different types of sources

B6A1A994FFD04DE98F4B4733E781199B.description: use the concepts of political thinking when interpreting and analysing evidence, data, and information relevant to their investigations; evaluating and synthesizing their findings; and formulating conclusions, predictions, and judgments about issues, events, and/or developments of civic importance

72D4D0972BC74CCF917700220809ED23.description: apply critical-thinking skills to assess the credibility and biases of relevant sources from a wide variety of media forms, including social media

EEF32BF73E1940B4A799484FC00FE87E.description: select and organize relevant evidence, data, and information on issues, events, and/or developments of civic importance from a variety of primary and secondary sources, including media forms such as social and traditional media, ensuring that their sources reflect multiple perspectives

EA79AA812F04445FA7114BBBE07F4B79.description: formulate different types of questions to guide investigations into issues, events, and/or developments of civic importance

A8759E3BB3BA48BC8CE8784093B7428C.description: Political Inquiry: use the political inquiry process and the concepts of political thinking when investigating issues, events, and developments of civic importance
